name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text: This bill is a win for our infrastructure, a win for #ClimateAction, and a win for Illinoisans.

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text: Additionally, the bill also provides investments in two key areas I‚Äôve advocated for since I first came to Congress, investing over $505 million for clean energy battery storage and $500 million for research and development in low-carbon industrial technologies.

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text: Illinois will receive $1.7 billion to improve our water infrastructure, ensuring communities across the state have access to clean, safe drinking water.

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text: Illinoisans will also benefit from the bill‚Äôs historic $3.5 billion national investment in weatherization which will reduce energy costs for families.

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:
From 2010 to 2020, Illinois experienced over $50 billion in damage due to extreme weather.

Illinois will receive $27 million to protect against extreme weather and make our infrastructure more resilient.

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:
14% of Illinois households do not have an internet subscription.

Illinois will now receive at least $100 million to provide internet access to the 228,000 Illinoisans who currently lack it.

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:
If we want to tackle the climate crisis, we have to transition to electric vehicles. This can‚Äôt happen if Illinoisans don‚Äôt have access to charging stations.

Illinois will receive $149 million to expand our EV charging network.

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:
Illinoisans who take public transportation spend an extra 68.3% of their time commuting due to crumbling infrastructure.

Illinois will now receive $4 billion to improve public transportation options across the state.

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text: In Illinois, there are 2,374 bridges and over 6,218 miles of highway in poor condition. Thanks to this bill, Illinois will receive $9.8 billion for federal-aid highway apportioned programs and $1.4 billion for bridge replacement and repairs.

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:
The bipartisan Investment in Infrastructure and Jobs Act provides a historic investment in Illinois. We‚Äôll receive billions of dollars to improve our roads, bridges, airports, broadband, EV charging, and so much more. 

Here‚Äôs what this bill will do for Illinois:

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text: I was also able to secure funding to help decarbonize our economy, including over $505 million for clean energy battery storage to increase the reliability & resilience of the electrical system & $500 million for research and development of low-carbon industrial technologies.

name: Rep. Sean Casten

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text: Over a year since the Kearns family lost their son, @Robinhoodapp finally offers 24-hour support. But it continues to function like a virtual casino, gamified to harness psychology to drive frequent, roulette-like trades, extracting fast money from inexperienced investors 8/

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text: In theory, there's no reason why responsible gamification couldn‚Äôt teach financial literacy & encourage responsible investing. But in practice, an app drawing young, inexperienced investors into high-volume day trades & complex options is not prioritizing users' safety. 5/

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:
To the public, @RobinhoodApp purports to be a democratizer of finance. To lawmakers, they claim to be a tech company. In neither case do they make a claim to maximize investor value. 

Robinhood‚Äôs algorithms are designed to feed fish to sharks. 4/  
https://t.co/me4rPxE9I6

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:
With users‚Äô real money at stake, @Robinhoodapp leverages gamified design to generate behavioral loops to push users - many of whom aren‚Äôt even old enough to gamble at a casino - not only to spend  more minutes engaged, but to make more trades. 3/
https://t.co/dhfCZ0Inhm

name: Rep. Sean Casten
tweet_text:
